column4: here is my bug report for nvidia activate but not in use, anyone able to help out? http://pastebin.com/n82pVU1x
invalid EDID
either try to get a valid EDID for your monitor, or specifiy the allowed resolutions manually,
e.g. with X Server modelines.
ugh haven't done those in many a moon. how would i get a valid edid?
do you have by chance windows on that machine?
for some unknwon reasons the driver there is a bit less picky, and you could use it to dump the EDID to a file, which can be fed to the linux driver with the UseCustomEDID Option
fuchs i have the same monitor on another computer with windows 7 if that helps but this box is linux only
oh, Malgorath, wait
you set this resolution by yourself in the xorg.conf
Option         "metamodes" "1360x768 +0+0"  <<
with nvidia settings
i used the nvidia settings but that was the highest it would go
then that might be due to the driver not be able to read the EDID
so should i just edit the xorg and add 1440x900?
you probably have to specify a modeline for that
there are tools that generate them for you
what are they called?\
gtf  is one
gtf short for anything?
it's the name of the tool, I have no idea whether it has a meaning
is it in apt repo or something i'd have to look up?
http://packages.ubuntu.com/search?searchon=contents&keywords=gtf&mode=exactfilename&suite=natty&arch=any
